projectDesc.p: This is my Master Thesis Project at Alma Mater Studiorum - University of Bologna. It has been found by my institution via a scholarship which allowed me to apend a research period of three months as a "visitor researcher" at Talos Project, at University of Crete (UoC). It is an experimental thesis project, since its aim is to elaborate a workflow toward the modelling, encoding and visualization of a Digital Scholarly Edition, with the tools and the fundings available to an italian master student. The purpose is way distant to be exaustive, and it has been not possible to realize a complete Digital Scholarly Edition, since adfirmed scholars admitt it is a task that requires "a village" of researchers. I consider this enterprise as my personal swan's last song, my last contribution in the field of classical philology, so I am trying to enjoy the most a kind of life that I don't feel as mine, the one of a classical philology researcher. I hope by this small contribution to add a small but hopefully significant brick in the tower of scientific community

segmentation.p: In the present project, the critical text has been subdivided into divisions containing further divisions, each of which has its own unique xml:id, of books and chapters. Since the encoding doesn't cover the full text, but only selected specimina, I decided to assign a number to every book and paragraph as the full work would have been encoded, so numbers may seem incoherent. This was made hoping to be able to completely encode the work in the next years, with no rush due to academic deadlines.

langUsage.p: The main two languages used in the present projects are ancient greek and english, the former used to represent the text of Xenophon's Symposium, and the latter is used for the encoding and the scientific aspect of my research.
